intro: Cologania pulchella var. racemosa, commonly known as the racemose cologania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. It is native to parts of North America and is often found in the southeastern United States.
